pr_title: DPC-860: Navigation bug on top tabs

timeline.message: Update stylesheets, rails version, and added home link

timeline.bodyText:
This can be shortened to:
<%= link_to "Home", root_path, class: "topnav__link" %>
timeline.author: switzersc-usds
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -22,6 +22,12 @@ aria-controls="topnav-wrap" aria-label="Close menu">
       </svg>
     </button>
     <ul class="topnav">
+      <li class="topnav__item">
+        <%= link_to root_path, :class => "topnav__link" do %>
+          Home
+        <% end %>

replies.bodyText: Ah, I just saw the other nav links are using the block pattern already. Not sure why -- it's longer and not necessary. I think the new link is fine as is for consistency, unless you feel like updating all the links to not use blocks. Up to you :)
replies.author: switzersc-usds

timeline.bodyText: How come this is necessary? These are all already being included in the app's stylesheets (app/assets/stylesheets/application.scss). I'm concerned about importing them again as 1) bad practice and 2) potentially loading all those files a second time.
timeline.author: switzersc-usds

replies.bodyText: Thanks for making a ticket for investigating this.
replies.author: dhgreene
